revised_title: Discovery of a Native Arseniate of Lead in Cornwall
tldr: In this article, William Gregor describes the discovery of a new lead ore in Cornwall, which he calls a native arseniate of lead. He provides a detailed account of the ore's physical properties, such as its crystal structure, color, and transparency. He also discusses various chemical tests and experiments to determine the composition of the ore, concluding that it is primarily composed of lead oxide and arsenic acid.
